J'y avais déjà joué il y a des années et du coup j'ai pas mal hésité à l'acheter de peur de tout connaître mais je ne regrette absolument pas ! 
Les graphismes sont très biens pour le genre, l'ambiance et les musiques (bien que parfois un peu répétitives mais ça ne gêne pas trop) sont prenantes, l'histoire est magnifique, bien tournée et assez surprenante mais j'ai eu du plaisir à remarquer quand même des détails qui permettent d'anticiper la fin, assez précis pour que ce ne soit pas juste des divagations de ma part et en même temps assez mystérieux ou invisibles quand on ne connait pas la fin, et on garde quand même le temps pour des théories même si malheureusement je ne pense pas qu'une suite ou qu'une explication voient le jour.. 
Et le "contenu additionnel" par rapport à la première version rend l'histoire encore meileure même si je ne me souviens pas de tous les détails de l'ancienne version :/ 
Ah et si vous ne parlez pas anglais, la plupart du temps il y a le temps pour les traductions et ça ne m'a pas l'air d'être de l'anglais très compliqué, les actions sont aussi plutôt claires donc ne vous arrêtez pas à la langue :)

38864399.review:
"Mad Father" is brilliant RPG Maker horror game. It's a story about Aya - young girl, daughter of a... well "mad" scientist. One night, due to certain curse, all of his experiments come to life, and Aya is the one who need to not only survive this madness, but also try to save her father.

This is one of the best known RPG Maker horror game - it is (or was?) available for free and I've played it then. Steam version has slightly different art, there's also "save yourself" mini game added. I don't remember all the story details well, so I'm not sure if anything had changed in that regard. Still, I think this game is well worth the money and it's nice that the creators of "Mad Father" are getting more recognition and hopefully, that they are making well deserved money.

"Mad Father" has amazing atmosphere, intriguing storyline and impressive attention to details. It captures all the best qualities of RPG Maker horror games, so if you're a fan of that type of games, you definitely don't want to miss out on that one.

38733683.review:
[b]BACKGROUND [/b]

Very briefly:

"Papa! Papa! Mommy .... .... Mommy noooo! Papa...  KYA! KYA! KYA! Papa~ .... .... DINKLEBURG"


[b]WHAT I ENJOYED ABOUT THIS GAME [/b]

Other than the low cost and fantastic storyline?

The play style is simple yet effective. Achievements are relatively easy to obtain as well.

I loved the playstyle and how very subtle decisions could affect the overall turn of the game. The puzzles aren't difficult and if you're paranoid like me, its okay, there's save points around most corners!

I love that this game encorporates so much 'horror' into itself. Since it's RPG we all know a lot of it won't be scary, but it has it's fair share of jump scares to get the heart attacks coming. 

This game has so much potential, it literally blows my mind. 


[b]WHAT THE GAME LACKED [/b]

There is very little lacking in this game. My only wish is that it could be longer with a longer and more defined storyline, a little polishing here and there, and it'd be perfect!


[b]CONCLUSION [/b]

I highly recommend this game.

38682121.review:
Mad Father es un juego de terror RPG publicado originalmente en el año 2011/2012, sin fines de lucro y creado con el programa Wolf RPG Editor por Sen (también responsable de Misao, juego disponible en Steam). En el año 2016, fue lanzado a la venta en la plataforma Steam.

¿Vale la pena? Acompáñame en la reseña.

[h1]Historia[/h1]
El comienzo no es nada del otro mundo. 
Aya, la protagonista, conoce el secreto de su padre, todas las noches escucha uno que otro grito de las víctimas que provienen del sótano, donde se encuentra ubicado el laboratorio. Pero una noche, el grito que resuena por toda la mansión es el de su padre, sintiéndose obligada a ir en su ayuda y enfrentar a los cadáveres vivientes que intentarán matarla a lo largo de su trayectoría. Aya es consciente de quién es la culpa, y aún así está dispuesta en salvar a su padre.

Pero no es así de simple, hay mucho más por descubrir.

[h1]Jugabilidad[/h1]
Jugar con teclado no es para nada un reto pero sí es muy cómodo, sobre todo en los Quicktime Events.
El juego pondrá en práctica tu sigilo, pues los enemigos te perseguirán y atacarán una vez te hayan visto (algunos te matarán al instante). También tu estrategia para acabar con ellos si tienes lo necesario en tu entorno y en tu inventario.
Se aplica mucho el [b]Ensayo y error[/b], más a la hora de sacar los finales.
Para guardar debemos de encontrar a un cuervo que nos dará cinco ranuras. Para los finales, es recomendable guardar por separado en vez de sobrescribir.
La [b]motosierra[/b] la adquiriremos en una de las salas de la mansión, con ella no podremos atacar al enemigo de manera directa sino cortar barriles y otros objetos que nos serán de ayuda para acabar con nuestro rival.
[b]Game Over[/b]: Es como cualquier otro juego de este tipo; morimos y empezamos donde guardamos por última vez. Recomiendo guardar la partida cuando veas al cuervo.

[h1]Gráficos[/h1]
El peso y rendimiento del juego no serán demasiados al estar desarollado en Wolf RPG Editor, cualquier Pc puede correrlo.
Para quienes han jugado a su primera versión, habrán notado el gran cambio que han hecho en los escenarios, los enemigos y personajes, son fascinantes hasta el más mínimo detalle. Y si hay quienes no han tenido la oportunidad de probarlo en sus inicios, este remaster les encantará. 

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
¿Qué decir? Maravilloso. Sublime. Único. Embriagador. Cada uno va acorde a la situación en la que se encontrará Aya. Hasta el silencio nos erizará la piel, pues nunca sabremos qué ocurrirá. 
No sé si incluir esto aquí pero aquí voy. Las risas de las víctimas nos harán sentir amenazados, creyendo que seremos atacados tarde o temprano. Ni hablar del grito desgarrador de Aya cuando hayamos sacado un Game Over.

[h1]Enemigos[/h1]
No todos son iguales. Algunos nos perseguirán y atacarán hasta vaciarnos la barra de salud; otros no dudarán en matarnos en ese preciso instante, llevándonos a la pantalla Game Over; otros no tendrán la intención de asesinarnos pero sí hay que tener cuidado con ellos si no hacemos el movimiento correcto. Como mencioné antes, necesitaremos de nuestro entorno e inventario para salir ilesos de la situación (más en el final).

[h1]Finales[/h1]
Un final bueno, dos malos más un Extra. 
Para sacar los tres finales, tendremos que aplicar el Ensayo y Error. 
Para sacar el Extra, tendremos que encontrar las 21 gemas y sacar el final bueno.

[h1]Personajes[/h1]
A algunos les tendremos cariño; a otros los odiaremos; a otros nos picará esa curiosidad de saber más de su historia. Si bien estaremos en la piel de Aya, también intentaremos estar dentro del zapato de otro para comprender el porqué de sus acciones.

[h1]Moraleja[/h1]
¿Perdonarías a alguien que ha sido capaz de cometer semejante atrocidad a otros?

[u]Resultado[/u]: 8.5/10

37797957.review:
Mad Father is like Misao: Definitive Edition a new great look for a classic rpg maker horror game. But unlike Misao: Definitive Edition witch was all most a remake. 

Mad Father is more of a remastered version then a remake like Misao. With update art, newly added events, and some new story. But anyway time for the story.

You play as Aya, a little girl who lost her mother about year ago. As she reflects on the past in her nursery she hears her father, who is a doctor screaming, so Aya gets up to see what is wrong but soon she sees what her father has been doing, so it’s up to her to save him. 

Now what I like about this game/the remastered version. I liked the new redesigns, not just for the undead monsters but the Drevis mansion as well. 

I mean the Drevis mansion looks more put together. Like in the old game Aya or her parents room looked a bit empty and looked the same, but now in the new game her room is more detailed. It just feels more real.

I liked that we got some new story for two characters in the game. Liked the creepy atmosphere. And I liked the music it could be vary creepy. Characters were good too.

Now for something I did not like changing the quick time event, you see in the old game you hit the spacebar but in the new game you hit the arrow keys, I don’t get it I liked the old way.

Now with all that done. Mad Father is one of the classic rpg maker horror game, that just got even better with this new remastered version. Great art, good scares, and a nice story. I recommend it wholeheartedly, for old and new fans alike.

I absolutely love this game. I'm not exactly a reviewer with good words to say, but Mad Father is a great game. I enjoy the art style, the story, the mechanics...I dislike only one thing about this game, and it's that oooone part where you have to flip the switch to open the door near the end and you're trying your best to not get chainsawed. Maybe it's me but I always take a while to not get, yknow, murdered because I had to flip a switch then juke you know who so I could actually get to the door. Maybe I just suck, I digress.
But I love this game. It'll break your heart, it'll make you happy, and personally for me, it left me wanting more after the true end because I just gotta know what happens after iiiit. 
The true end - the endgame, if you will - is quite good. It doesn't peaches and cream you in the future.
Basically this game is great and I'm no reviewer but I will love it forever please buy this game!

36608376.review:
*SPOILER FREE REVIEW*

As a huge fan of pixel horror RPGs, I was very happy to see Mad Father on here; I've watched people play it before and enjoyed it enough that I wanted to have a go myself, and it did not disappoint!

Technically speaking, the controls are very simple and the game is easy to navigate.  I do have to say, however, that I wouldn't recommend expanding the screen size despite the relatively small window it opens in, as the visuals get VERY fuzzy and distorted.  It simply wasn't made for the fullscreen experience.  However, unless you're overly finicky about something like that, I can promise you that the smaller game screen does not affect your enjoyment of the game.  It's a minor detail that is very easily forgotten about once you start playing.

Concerning the plot, I think it's a great story that isn't too complicated, but it doesn't stop the revelations from being exciting and the intentions of the villain from being disturbing.  The fact that I'd already seen the entire game before and knew how it ended made no difference to how much I enjoyed it playing it myself, and I really did.  I like the level of challenge in that it was relatively easy to figure out what to do next without getting stuck and having to look it up.  The horror aspect of the game is well done in that it doesn't rely on sudden jumpscares or loud noises, but is more subtle in the way it creeps you out.  It's in the way something looks or moves.  There were some great moments that made me gasp that were simply something in the background moving for a second, or something appearing that wasn't there before.  This isn't a plot spoiler, but as an example of such, I love the moment you leave the kitchen while the rabid dog is still in it for the first time, and just as you activate the door, the dog suddenly flies across the room running so fast and is right behind you as the visual cuts to black.  There wasn't even a noise that came with it, but I genuinely freaked out for a second cos it was unexpected and very sneaky!  There are a lot of great moments like that that keep you on your toes.  I also really appreciate the game's very sparse use of voices and speech, as pretty much the only voice you will hear throughout the game is the protagonist's little gasps, unsure noises and screams, and then the odd monster groan.  Hardly any other characters are voiced, which means that when you do suddenly hear a voice out of the blue, it has that much more impact.  Again, I'm not going to spoil, because this one does involve a MASSIVE plot point, but there's a hugely important character that never speaks aloud until a certain moment, and when they do, it's the most creepy, malicious sounding voice of the whole game, yet almost an intimate murmur-in-your-ear in the way it's delivered... it gave me a full body shiver because it was so creepy!

The plot was decently paced and the game felt like the right length for the story, not too long or short.  The twists are, while potentially easy to spot in advance, very enjoyable and you really get a feel of being that protagonist trapped in a horrible situation where you just want the people you love to be alive and happy and all get along, but it just doesn't seem like it's able to work out that way, forcing you to make very tough decisions and choose between people you'd rather not.  There are several endings to achieve, and the 'true' ending definitely has a sinister twist to it that you really don't expect after going through what you went through.  There is also a very cleverly written and very mysterious character that I still don't believe anyone truly understands.  Once you play it, you'll know exactly who I'm talking about. 
 He appears friendly and helps the protagonist, yet he then goes on to do certain things behind her back that contradict that, and his true intentions are never revealed, leaving him to perpetually walk the line between good and evil without you ever understanding who he is and what he's trying to achieve.  I felt loyal to him one moment and scared of him the next, and I love his character because he infuriates me!  I want to know!

One last thing that's important to say; Mad Father was being sold at Halloween in the Bloodsoaked Bundle with the game Misao.  They might not be bundled anymore, but once you've played Mad Father, I still highly recommend you play Misao because...  in the least spoilery way possible, there's a continuation.  The actual main games seem completely unrelated to each other, but let's just say there are characters and themes that are related to Mad Father that appear unexpectedly with no warning in Misao.  If you weren't familiar with Mad Father, you wouldn't even realise.  In the small moments that they do appear, they give you extra information on the more mysterious and unresolved elements of Mad Father that, while not providing a definitive answer, set a lot of possibilities running through your head.  I very much like that sneaky little extra.  Do try it for yourself.

Right, I've rambled enough!  Short version: Mad Father is one of my very favourite games of this genre and you should definitely give it a go.  Interesting plot, creepy villain, drama and deceit, running for your life, and mysteries that never quite get an answer...  also, who doesn't love a good chainsaw?

36602094.review:
Played the original back in the day, along with Misao, Witch's House, Ib and others.
The remake made everything even better for me, as far as i remember the old one.

This game is a japanese horror story centered around a girl whose father is a mad scientist, her mother is dead and they live in a mansion. Sounds cheesy, but trust me, it's not. It's almost like a visual novel, but with actual exploration, puzzles and hidden secrets.

The story have a lot of twists and while i think it's amazingly well written, i do not recommend it to children or anyone really bothered by dark toned stories. It's not about the jumpscares. There are almost little to none on this one. (I only remember a single one that was actually frightening) It's the tone of the story. A bit too cruel.

If you're fine with that then give it a go, it's gonna keep you busy for at least 3 hours (maybe less).

36342626.review:
So... I am actually pretty scared of horror games, but I love this style of pixel games, so I decided to buy it and try it out
Funny thing is, I actually got really scared after playing it for 10mins, so I went into a friend's dorm, and made her sat next to me to play it (<w<;; But it was also to pressure myself to play it so that it won't be a waste of money)
Anyway!! I'm sure that for some people this is actually NOT scary at all, but that's not the reason of why you should avoid or just buy the game for, it actually has a reaaaaaally nice story. Like I would give it a 9, and 0.5+ for the after story, leaving 0.5 for the errors, bugs, to not to be as biased, blah blah blah. 
The game mechanics are really simple, aaaand *epic music* collecting things in this game is easy, fun and important, so you don't feel like you are wasting time looking for the orbs, looking through every room, and clicking everywhere to find something (I have quite the OCD when it comes to collecting things ingame)
The logic/puzzle is pretty simple once you get the grasp, and even if you get murdered, burned, bitten, killed, [spoiler] chased to death by your loving father (that part did scare me REALLY bad) [/spoiler], you can aaaalways find a way out. Oh oh, however there are this few places where its all about speed reaction, so good luck!!
Uhm... So overall, yes, I would recommend this game!! If you are scared, just drag someone, tie her/him in a chair to force him/her to play instead of you while you watch ;3

Mad father tem como tema aquele terrorzinho psicólogico. Tem partes que ele realmente assusta, porem não é algo tão grandiosso. O forte do jogo mesmo é a história! Principalmente quando você percebe que o universo de Mad father e de Misao se misturam.

 O remake é muito bom (Tirando a nova arte que eu achei meio tosca). Se você quer realmente jogar o jogo eu recomendo a versão original, é grátis, tem a mesma história e tradução para o português. Ainda assim não posso descriminar esse remeke, a casa da família Drevis tá bem mais bonita, tem sustos novos e uma pequena (muito pequena mesmo) mudança nos puzzles.

 Uma coisa que eu amei nesse remeke foi saber que o Dio tá vivo. Nunca consegui pegar o final "If" no original, ou seja, isso foi novo para mim.

 Eu realmente espero que assim como Mad father e Misao, Ib e The witch's house também ganhe um remake.

36224544.review:
[h1]Mad Father İncelemesi[/h1] 
 
[b]Son zamanlarda oyun oynayan insanların bakış açıları büyük oranda değişti.Oyuncular artık rekabete dayalı multiplayer oyunlara yöneldi , oynanışa bakmaz oldular.Onların dini imanı Grafik ve Rekabet  oldu kuşkusuz.Tabi oyuncuların bu yönelimi karşısında oyun sektörüde büyük bir renovasyon içine girdi ve bir çok tür unutulmaya yüz tuttu.Şüphesiz bu türlerin en başlarında 'RPG MAKER' oyun motoruyla yapılan oyunlar yer alıyor.RPG MAKER oyunların en büyük özelliği kuşkusuz grafiksel anlamda kötü işler çıkmasına rağmen oyuncuyu oyun içi detaylarla , hikayeyle ve bulmacalarla oyun içinde tutması.Mad Father'da bu türün kaltieli yapımlarından bir tanesi.[/b]
 
[i]Kafanızı fazla ütülemeden incelemeye başlayayım.Yazı uzun olduysa şimdiden özür dilerim :)[/i] 

[h1]11 Yaşında Yalnızlık..[/h1]  [i]Karakterimiz Aya ; 11  yaşında küçük bir kız çocuğudur.Çocukken annesi Monika'yı bir hastalık sonucu kaybeden Aya'nın , Babası Alfred dışında bu hayatta başka kimsesi kalmamıştır.Fakat babası bilim adamıdır. Her gün Aya'nın girmesinin yasak olduğu laboratuvarda deneyler yapmaktadır.Bu sebeple babası Aya'ya çok az vakit ayırabilmektedir.Ama Babası ve Aya'nın ortak olarak hiç kaçırmadan yaptıkları etkinlik her ölüm yıldönümünde Monika'nın mezarını ziyaret etmektir.[/i] 

[h1]Bir Ölüm yıldönümü Daha...[/h1]   [i]Annesinin ölümyıldönümünün arifesinde ; Aya ve babası  yatmadan önce  yarın Monika'nın mezarına her sene olduğu gibi gideceklerini söylerler birbirlerine.Babası Alfred , Aya'yı odasına gönderir.Aya Odasına giderken babasının Laboratuvarından Testere ve çığlık sesleri duyar.Fakat bununda babasının deneylerinden biri olduğunu düşünür ve uyur.Uyandığında evlerinin hayaletler ve diğer garip yaratıklar tarafından işgal edildiğini ve evin lanetlendiğini görür.Gördüklerinden korkan Aya babasını arar ama bulamaz.Bu saatten sonra Aya babasını arayacak , evin lanetini kaldırmaya çalışacak ve Evin korkunç sırlarını öğrenecektir. 

[h1]Eski Versiyon ve Yeni Versiyon[/h1] [b]Oyunun eski versiyonu 10 Aralık 2012 Tarihinde ; Yeni versiyonu 23 Eylül 2016 Tarihinde Çıktı.Eski versiyonu Steam'de bulunmuyordu , yeni versiyonla birlikte Mad Father'da Steam Platformuna giriş yaptı arkadaşlar.Yeni Versiyonda Grafiksel olarak iyileştirmeye gidilmiş bunun dışında oynanışta neredeyse hiç bir değişiklik yok.Eski versiyonda bulmacaları  çözmek için gereken eşyaları  , yeni versiyonda değiştirmişler fakat bulmacanın çözüm yoluna dokunulmamış.Bu sayede eski versiyon için yapılan oynanış videoları ve walkthroughlar yeni versiyon oyuncuları tarafındanda kullanılabiliyor.[/b] 

[h1]Sudoku Niyetine..[/h1][b]Oyunda genel olarak amacımız evin odalarını araştırmak , bu odalardan bulduğumuz eşyaları diğer alanları açmak için kullanmak.Her alanı açtığımızda evin giz perdesi biraz daha iniyor.Tabi bu alanları açmaya çalışırken karşımıza bulmacalar geliyor.Bulmacalar Zor da değil kolay da değil.Genelde ayrıntılı bir şekilde evi incelerseniz o bulmacada gereken eşyaları buluyorsunuz.Fakat o eşyalar envanterinizde olsa bile bulmacaları çözmek karışık gelebiliyor.Bazı bulmacalarda 'aaa mantığımı çalıştırırsam yapabiliyormuşum' diyerek 10 dakika boyunca hayıflanıyorsunuz.Bazı bulmacalarda ise 'lan böyle şey mi olur' diyerek olayın mantığını kavramaya çalışıyorsunuz. 

[h1]Müzik Ziyafeti.[/h1] 
[b]Oyunun müzikleri kelimenin tam anlamıyla 'EFSANE'.Uzun Süredir ('To The Moon' Maceramdan Beri) böyle kaliteli müzikler dinlememiştim.Uygun zamanda , uygun tonda , uygun müzikler çalmakta arkada.Oyun boyunca belkide en yakın arkadaşınız bu müzkler olacak :)  

[h1]Teknik Problemler.[/h1]  [b]Oyunun en büyük problemi şüphesiz teknik sorunlar.Oyun tam ekran olmuyor.Bazı ayarlarla oynayarak ekranı büyültebiliyorsunuz ama yine Tam Ekran olmuyor oyun.Oyun boyunca steamden gelen bildirimler ekranda takılıp kalıyor ve siz SHİFT+TAB yapmadığınız sürece ekranda durmaya devam ediyor.ALT+TAB ve benzeri kısayollar yapmanız oyunu çökertmekte bu sebeple oyunda takıldığınız bir yere internetten bakmak için oyunu alta almadan önce save almayı unutmayın. 

[code]PUANLAMA[/code] 

[b]Artılar : Oyuncuyu İçine Çeken Hİkaye , Efsane Müzikler , Güzel Dizayn Edilmiş Karakterler , Bulmacalar.[/b] 

[b]Eksiler  : Teknik Sorunlar , Korkutucu Bir Oyun Değil [/b] 

[code]Puan 9/10 : Oyun hikayesiyle sizi içine çekiyor ve sizi oynanış süresi boyunca meraklandırıyor.Müzikler ve ses efektleri  çoğu AAA oyununun müziklerini geçecek seviyede.Oyunun en büyük sorunu maalesef 2016 yılında çıkmış bir oyunda olmaması gereken teknik sorunlar.  [/code]

36182176.review:
Hay que decirlo, es un clásico de los juegos de "terror" en Rpg Maker\Wolf Editor más famoso de todos y se merecía estar por aquí y a buen precio.
Basicamente es cómo una especie de remaster del anterior Mad Father que conocemos, mejorando en gráfica, animación, historia, etc...
Es la misma historia que siempre sabiamos de principio a fin, solo que con lo nuevo y añadido, se comprende bastante mejor la historia y con mejor detalle.
La verdad es que la recomiendo si no eres un tiquismiquis del inglés (aunque la versión gratuita esta en español), es un buen regalo para los que nos encanta meternos en este tipo de historias y de videojuegos sin necesidad de emocionarnos si son gráficazos de última hora.

34803953.review:
Mano do céu
Eu conheci Mad Father em 2014, confere. Só início desse ano eu pensei, putz, tem na steam, vou pegar. Eu levei 8 meses pra FINALMENTE encostar e jogar, e caralho. Eu não joguei de início porque sou fraca com jumpscare etc etc, mesmo que tenha poucos, ainda tinha o fator de "eu sei o que vai acontecer aqui e vou me assustar".
Primeiramente: EU AMO MAD FATHER MELHOR QUE IB mas só não vence pra The Witch's House (rs @steam quero viu)
Segundamente: Eu demorei demais pra perceber que tinha coisa a mais, que no caso era o IF. Eu fiquei irritada e feliz ao mesmo tempo com isso, mas ok.
Tipo, num geral ficamos 5 anos acreditando que o Dio era um dos vários testes e que tava morto, pra mim foram 3. Aí cês me vem com o IF dizendo que ele tava vivo desde sempre. Eu queria meter o cacete no Sen por causa disso mas vida segue. 
Eu recomendo, DEMAIS, pegarem a versão da Steam. Não só por isso, mas o visual num geral mudou e ficou muito bonito. Eu só fico meio inquieta com o sprite default da Aya por causa dos olhos (também como a Monika)
Ficou muito mais... suave? Por assim dizer de jogar, os sprites mesmos que pequenos pixels têm mais emoções, mais movimento. Foi uma boa decisão fazer o 2.0, ao invés de dizer "toma aí, a mesma versão de 5 anos atrás com nada novo" (indireta pra Miwashiba, porque..... colocar na steam algo ligeiramente recente é quase suicídio, todo mundo já jogou de graça antes lol)
E também gostei como alteraram algumas cenas, tipo a de quando você pega todas as gemas. Achei bem melhor que o antigo. (E falando em gemas, a do cachorro estufado você pega o osso com a mandrágora assim que matar o cachorro. Não é mais no labirinto de bonecas. Assim como o "grande corredor" de antigamente, agora é na "sala de espelho".)
Espero que assim como Mad Father, outros jogos de RPG Maker mais antigos entrem pra cá, adoraria jogar os quais não tive chance (por medo).

P.S.: eu sou muito gay pelo Dio eu quero que ele seja feliz com a Aya ta.

34400657.review:
Das Spiel hat mich wegen des Trailers angezogen, obwohl ich vorher dachte, dass mir die Grafik nicht so sehr gefallen würde. Aber das hat ehrlich gesagt auch den Charme ausgemacht. Die Story im Spiel selbst ist bizarre, spannend, mit unerwarteten Wendungen, ein paar cleveren(auch wenn nicht sehr schwierigen) Rätseln und einem überraschendem Ende. 

Die Welt um die Charaktere ist recht detailliert gestaltet und bietet genug Raum, damit die Figuren einem ans Herz wachsen, obwohl das Spiel mit 4,5h eher kurz ist. Ich hätte mir sehr gerne mehr gewünscht und würde mich über einen zweiten Teil freuen.
Was das Spiel noch so einzigartig macht ist zum großen Teil der stimmungsvollen Musik, sowie den Soundeffekten zu verdanken. Wirklich gut inszeniert und liebevoll zusammengestellt. 
Man spürt, dass da jemand dran saß, der Spaß daran hatte die Story aufzubauen.

Alles in allem ein gelungenes Spiel, das einem im Gedächtnis bleibt.

33848229.review:
Posiblemente uno de los juegos más conocido en cuanto a terror hecho en RPG maker, aun así, ¿Su fama es merecida? Y mejor aún, preguntarse  ¿Realmente vale la pena pagar 5$ por este tipo de juegos cuando hay tantos juegos en la misma categoría que son totalmente gratis? Pues con tal solo ver la manito que se encuentra a mi izquierda debería alcanzar para que conozcas mi opinión, pero rápidamente diré…Si, lo vale.  A continuación daré mi opinión con más detalles

* Como siempre, empezamos con lo más interesante de estos juegos, y como es de esperarse la encuentro bastante única, quizás predecible en algunos aspectos, pero como ya dije, única.  Dime, alguna vez has experimentando alguna historia donde desde el comienzo sabemos que el causante y responsable de los males sigue siendo alguien que tiene cierto afecto nosotros (La protagonista) y nuestro deber no es ni matarlo o si quiera detenerlo, más bien salvarlo. Esto da lugar a un interesante tema que se va desarrollando a lo largo del juego acerca si es posible perdonar y incluso cambiar a alguien que ha cometido atrocidades a otros seres vivos.

*Luego tenemos la estética, que es bastante llamativa, mientras que los salones no sorprenden mucho en cuanto a la forma, suelo o incluso paredes, resalta mucho en objetos, y sobre todo en personajes, si lo has comprado te invito a que observes con detalle el pixel art que llevan, sobre todo las criaturas, cualquier fanático/a del dibujo pixelado le encantara, y no olvidemos  la enorme  cantidad de objetos que hay en cada sala, es increíble el esfuerzo y dedicación que hay visualmente, se nota bastante que este juego paso por muchas actualizaciones hasta lograr la belleza que es hoy.

* Vamos al gameplay, aquí hay bastante que señalar ya que utiliza ciertos recursos que son muy subjetivos. Mejor empecemos lo que comparte con otros juegos.  Los puzzles son bastante sencillos y fáciles, puede que estés perdiendo más tiempo en buscar lo que necesitas para resolver el acertijo que en pensar en cómo resolverlo, lo cual puede hacerlo un poco molesto más si tomamos en cuenta que varias veces hay que regresar a zonas ya investigadas.  Y mientras la mitad del juego se resuelve bastante fácil, la otra mitad se convierte en morir una y otra vez en el ya tan conocido término “Prueba y error”  por suerte, casi siempre hay un “checkpoint” o guardado justo antes de la parte donde muuuy probablemente llegemos a la pantalla de “game over”. Lo cual dudo en contarlo como algo positivo, pero está en usted, mi querido/a lector de contarlo como tú quieras. ¿Y qué hay del gameplay  “no común” en estos juegos? Son más bien, una especie de minijuegos, como quick time events o secciones de sigilo, los cuales agregan cierta variedad que fueron realmente de mi agrado, pero reitero, puedo que a ti lector sea totalmente lo opuesto, aunque debo admitir que volver a pasarlo cuando estoy haciendo un “Re run” es bastante molesto.

*Hay muchos aspectos más del que quiero hablar, pero siempre término hablando de más ¿Verdad? Bueno, esto es lo que más me llamo la atención, el nivel de detalle y secretos que tiene.
¿Detalle? Puede que uno usualmente no se dé cuenta de estas cosas, pero realmente hacen la diferencia, ¡puedes caminar en diagonales!, una signo de exclamación aparecerá sobre tu cabeza cuando te encuentres próximo a una casilla de algo que puedes examinar, los ruidos que emiten los personajes cuando hablan son cosas que uno puede pasar por alto, mas allá de eso… ¿Secretos? Si, desde que interactuar varias veces con un mismo objecto provoque una nueva frase, de una manera que no tiene sentido, pero si lo pasas y vuelves a iniciar tiene un cierto sentido, lo cual aporta algo de re jugabilidad que se aprecia mucho en estos juegos, hablando de eso, hay un bonus si encuentras todas la gemas en una sola partida lo cual te invita a que investigues todos tus alrededores, pena que hay veces donde no puedes volver para atrás y llegaste a olvidar uno suerte en la próxima partida, yo haría que no necesariamente tengas que obtener todos sino una mayoría, me niego a jugarlo de nuevo al menos por ahora,  pero algún día juntare todas y podré ver ese bonus.

En fin, tiene sus fallas pero realmente valió la pena cada centavo por su detalle y propuesta que me mantuvo pendiente hasta que lo termine.

33690558.review:
An intriguing horror story with an environment and characters to match. 

Gothic inspired horror is wonderfully realized through exploration and the uncovering of the dark secrets of your family’s estate. The gameplay has elements of dungeon exploration as you try to find your way to your father and rescue him after a curse has been set upon your home. This game features beautiful music with covers and renditions of classical music that further add to the ambiance. The artstyle is also well done, but doesn't exactly fit the tone of what you would expect of a gothic horror story set in Germany; the art is reminiscent of Japanese anime/manga as opposed to European classical.  

Mad Father is fun, creepy, and a good way to spend a couple hours of any evening. 

8/10

[b]Mad father[/b] - небольшой 2D хоррор с головоломками, сделанный в рпг-мейкере.
Вкратце, отец главной героини Айи - учёный, работающий в своей подземной лаборатории, ставя опыты на живых людях, создавая из них [spoiler]*Спойлер_Алёрт*[/spoiler]... Дочь давно об этом в курсе, но всё равно любит отца и на протяжении всей игры пытается спасти его от проклятия.

Эх.. наверное самая странная и сложная игра в моей жизни. Сложная не из-за трудности прохождения, а понятия сюжета и фактической концовки. Японцы всегда мудряд, и в сей раз тоже не отличается. Главное, это то, что нет Хэппи энда, как бы ты не искал смысл, или фантазировал, факты дают понять, что всё плохо., поэтому наверное одна из смертей главной героини является самой стабильной и красивой концовкой. Впечатление двоякое, с одной стороны очень цепляет своей жуткой атмосферой и милотой персонажей, с другой кровавая линия сюжета, в которой нет света и добра, а даже если и есть добрые поступки, всё закончиться кровью., не сказать, что это сильный минус, просто хотел действительнно хорошую концовку, а не то, что выходит в конце. 
В Любом случаи как можно пройти мимо чудо-девочки с бензопилочкой. Педобратья оценят.

[/list]
 
[u][i]Итог:[/i][/u]

Etant habitué au genre FPS et stratégie militaire, j'avais acheté ce jeu par bon de recommandation. Et je ne savais pas du tout à quoi m'attendre !

On suit l'histoire d'une petite fille qui se prénome Aya. Une petite fille vivant dans un grand manoire avec son père; un docteur fou faisant d'horrible expèrience dans son laboratoire situé au sous-sol de la maison. Ce dernier est accompagné de son assitante Maria; une assistante fidèle et dévouée au docteur et qui assiste à toute ces expèreiences machiavéliques. Le jour de l'annivairessaire de la défunte mère d'Aya, rien ne va plus. Des choses horribles commencent à se produire dans la maison, et Vous devez tout faire pour sauver votre père et survivre à l'horreur.

Résultant d'une histoire touchante avec gameplay fluide, des niveaux correctes et une bande son sympathique...je recommande donc fortement Mad Father.  ♥♥♥♥

One of the most enjoyable RPG games I've played in a while. Though the jump scares weren't anything to sneeze at, the music and atmosphere that it brought really brought the game together as a horror RPG. I adore the sprite animations, and I really enjoyed the 'If' Ending because it was refreshing to step into another character's shoes, if only for a brief moment. 
This game has fantastic replay value and the achievements are manageable for even the less seasoned players. I got so frustrated my first play through when I ruined my chances of a True Ending because I didn't properly explore, but it was so fun starting over again to guarantee the ending that I wanted to experience. 
Overall, it's a well made, beautifully atmospheric game that's very afforrdable to play if you're really not sure about the style!

31613022.review:
I remember when I started this game, early on, I walked into the next room over from Aya's bedroom. And the first thing that appeared in there was a blood-covered zombie maid. Far from being frightened or unsettled, my reaction was more like "Really? Seriously?" I carried that feeling of mixed contempt and incredulity through the whole game.

It felt to me like the writing, the characters, the environmental design, the arbitrary stealth sections where you navigate around murderous dolls... almost everything about this game seemed to be messed up for the sake of being messed up. There is absolutely no subtlety to the horror, from beginning to end. Mad Father does not have a good buildup of tension like there is in, say, Oxenfree or Fran Bow. Well-designed horror starts with small, unsettling things and gradually works up to the unspeakable horrors. MF threw the horrors at me within the first 30 minutes, and with that as a baseline I quickly got used to seeing blood and mutilated bodies all over the place. I wasn't frightened, like I have been in any number of other horror adventure games - just tense and annoyed.

You go from one too-easy puzzle to the next, broken up by segments where an inexplicable monster will try to kill you. You learn more about the messed up characters - and almost all of them are messed up, not just the titular Mad Father (someone has a murder fetish! Try to guess who! :D ). Eventually, you learn a secret that could have been telegraphed all the way from the prologue. And there are jump scares all the way. 

The only thing I thought was good about the game were the visual effects. The random spooky things that happen in the background as you wander through the mansion and is 4-5 basement levels were generally well done. Perhaps if the game had relied more on those than on killer jumpscares, it would have made for a more compelling experience. But as it is, it feels more to me like I *endured* a game than played one.

31284220.review:
At $5 you really can't go wrong picking this up, hell honestly, I'd pay $10 for it even though it only took me a bit over 2 1/2 hours to beat myself, though I'm great with puzzle games, so your mileage may vary compared to mine.

You essentially play a 10-year-old girl in a fancy mansion, when she goes to bed, you wake up to a much different mansion full of horrors, etc.

When consulting this review please take in mind I have never heard of this game before today, and therefore I have yet to have played it before it came to PC.

[h1]GAMEPLAY: 8/10: Excellent with good and easy controls and lots of puzzles, though some may be too easy.[/h1]
The gameplay is quite excellent in that the controls are very simple and easy to learn and quite responsive, and the puzzles are pretty nice, albiet a bit easy for most people's tastes if you ask me. You will need to backtrack from time to time, but this back tracking always comes with minor to major changes in whatever room or rooms you're going back through, which makes it both worth it and a bit creepy to continue on.

[h1]GRAPHICS: 8.5/10: Excellent and detailed visuals with only minor complaints.[/h1]
I'm a huge fan of games that have that good old fashioned RPG Maker VX feel and this one nails it whilst being detailed and unique enough to where it looks far beyond the quality of what most people are capable of making in said program. I do not have any real major gripes with the graphics with the exception of two things: I feel that the character portraits being a bit low-res/pixelated is a bit of a distraction, and I feel like the sprites, especially of Aya's(the girl's) sprite, should have had more expressions (pupils shrinking during fear, etc.) But these issues are probably just a bit of pickiness on my part, and it may just have been tricky with the sprites' resolutions.

[h1]STORY: 8.5/10: Too short for my tastes, but if it were extended, I'd pay many times more! It's great to me.[/h1]
The story is solid and quite enjoyable and suspenseful, albeit a bit predictable. They go over backstories and flashbacks and explain most of what you want or need to know, with the best ending (yes there's multiple endings) being quite the treat. Overall, quite solid. What keeps it from going above the 8.5 however is that it is short, like really short. Don't get me wrong, movies are only an hour and a half long most of the time, so compared to the playtime I got my money's worth. IF the creator decides to release a sequel, I would absolutely buy it. If the game were re-released to have a 8-12 hour or longer story, I would pay $30+ for it.

[h1]SOUND: 9/10: Plenty of high-quality sound effects and some voice acting![/h1]
The soundtrack is a bit small but fits the mood and atmosphere. Along with this, there is voice acting for grunting/moaning/screaming, as well as a bit of voice acting for the Father that absolutely makes the game reach its potential much more smoothly. There is no noticable bad quality anywhere in the audio and there's plenty of sound effects for all the events and things you may do in the game. The only thing keeping this from being a 10/10 is that in some cases the music will straight up stop for a bit (though this may be intentional?), and I wouldn't have minded a bit more music for the background. Not a huge issue at all though.

[h1]VALUE: 11/10: For just $5 you get a game that's sure to be a memorable one.[/h1]
Where can you pay the equivalent of a hot lunch at a burger joint for a well made game that's more than worth playing for puzzle and horror fans? Right here you can. I really don't have too much to say for this category, it's an excellent value, and I wouldn't have minded paying $7-$10 for it even if it's short. There is replayability though, in that there are multiple endings and some extra details to be found.

[h1]OVERALL: 9/10 - Highly recommended![/h1]

31248236.review:
I wanted to like this game so badly.  I bought it to support the developer, who had released a number of freeware games back in the day.  But, this game is just terrible.  From the awful and clunky controls, the simplistic and needlessly frustrating puzzles, to the fact that if you're not careful you can get yourself caught in an infinite death loop towards the end of the game.  And to be quite honest, this game has some of the worst sound design and mixing I've ever heard in a game.  In a lazy attempt to get a scare out of the player, it will make certain sounds so ear-piercingly loud that you wish you played with the game on mute.  Including the music that plays when you die...which continues to play after reloading your last save.  Gradually getting louder and louder for no apparent reason, to the point where it actually drowns out the rest of the game for a good 5-10 seconds.  This happens every.  Single.  Time.  Every time you make a mistake, just mute your speakers or take off your headphones, because your eardrums are about to be beaten harder than a pedophile in prison.  On that note, what little voice acting there is will make you cringe so hard that onlookers will believe you to be having some kind of seizure.

The story starts of interestingly enough, presenting the player with a unique moral dilemma.  Unfortunately, said dilemma is completely tossed out the window no more than 15 minutes into the game.  Leaving you with one of the most disappointing endings that you'll ever have the misfortune to witness.

For crying out loud, don't buy this game.  It's uninspired, dull and downright obnoxious at times.

31146586.review:
For all newcomers, Mad Father is a classic horror from when rpgmaker horrors were taking YouTube by storm. In conjunction with Misao (which has come out since the time of this review), a fairly addictive series has begun. Thought-provoking story, gameplay which combines puzzle-solving, quick-time mini events, and other such features, and multiple endings, achievements, a gallery, and "If" segment ready to be unlocked.

To those who know this from the freeware version that was available before, there were some changes, but all for the better, in my opinion. Art was cleaned up, bonus unlockable segment added, and the characters of the "blonde youth" and creepy-corpse-girl-which-follows-the-player-around are flushed out to their fullest in this version. 

Mad Father is a jewel in the genre of rpgmaker horror games, and this is the standard version to get. You can certainly spare the $5.

UPDATE: Another game by the same creator named [i]Misao[/i] [The Definitive Edition] is now available to buy! A seperate story, but interlaced in the same universe. Check that one out too! View my review on Misao if you are interested on my thoughts in particular.

31097367.review:
Se você chegou até aqui, quer dizer que você gosta do gênero RPG Maker né?
Caso sua resposta seja positiva, continue lendo a análise!

[h1]Sumário[/h1]
Mad Father (Pai Maluco) é um RPG Maker Horror Game feito por volta de 2012.
Conta a história de uma jovem garotinha chamada Aya Drevis, onde ela se mete numa terrível maldição que assolou sua família...
A maldição ressuscitou os mortos e eles querem vingança contra a família Drevis!
Será que você vai conseguir sobreviver nesse caos?

[h1]Um Clássico de RPG Maker[/h1]
Nâo seja enganado, apesar dele ser meio "antigo", a história, jogabilidade (principalmente na versão Steam) são muito boas!
Esse é título é um dos Clássicos, caso você esteja começando a jogar RPG Makers ou caso você já seja um veterano nesse universo, SEM DÚVIDAS você deve jogar esse jogo!

[h1]Versão Zero Corpse[/h1]
Como muito já sabem, esse jogo "era gratuito" e sua versão "gratuita"(antiga) foi traduzida pela Zero Corpse, um grupo de traduções brasileiro.
Nessa versão traduzida, que é bem antiga, a jogabilidade pode ser frustrante, algumas coisas não são "tão óbvias" e, infelizmente, a versão da Zero Corpse tem um BUG MORTAL.
Quando você cumpre os requisitos pra pegar o True Ending (Final Verdadeiro), supostamente, depois de terminar o jogo, você deveria ter acesso a GALERIA, não é?
Entretanto, se você jogar na versão da Zero Corpse, você NÃO VAI TER ACESSO A GALERIA!!!!
Por quê? Não sei, é um bug que tem na versão da Zero Corpse...
Até a Data da Publicação desta análise (12.04.2017) o bug existe e não foi consertado...

Caso você tenha interesse de ver a Versão da Zero Corpse, dê uma olhada na minha gameplay de Mad Father:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0BYjbcCzL48

[h1]Versão Steam[/h1]
Ah...! Que maravilha!
O jogo sofreu várias alterações e para melhor, claro!
Houve mudanças de textura, cenários diferentes, layouts diferentes, vários inimigos e aliados mudaram de imagem, ou tiveram suas imagens melhoradas, inclusive suas formas dentro do jogo!
O jogo está com uma dinâmica mais amigável. Agora a gente não precisa ser uma Mãe Dináh e adivinhar o que fazer e como fazer as coisas...
O jogo agora demonstra, através de uma exclamação na sua cabeça, as coisas que você pode interagir!
Maravilhoso não é?
Sabe aqueles momentos "tensos" onde você tinha que apertar "Z" pra vencer o perigo?
Eles mudaram essa mecânica, pruma mecânica mais interessante, agora você vai ter que apertar uma sequência de direcionais pra poder sair do perigo!
Acha que é só isso????
Inocente!!!
Eles acrescentaram mais profundidade no desenvolvimento de alguns personagens!!
Agora a gente pode saber a história por trás dos personagens mais relevantes do jogo!
INCLUSIVE a gente fica sabendo de como o Pai da Aya (Alfred) encontrou a Mãe dela (Monika)!

Caso você tenha interesse de ver as novas modificações, dê uma olhada na minha gameplay de Mad Father:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ELHa-4vsmaI

O jogo é um Clássico de RPG Maker, se você realmente gosta de RPG Maker Games, faça um favor a você mesmo, jogue esse game!
A versão da Steam custa apenas 10,49!
Não seja pão duro! O jogo é bom e o autor merece ganhar um pouco de dinheiro, não é?
Ele não deve viver de osmose certo?
Sem contar que o jogo está ATUALIZADO e com VÁRIAS MODIFICAÇÕES!!
Vale cada centavo!

31063500.review:
Resumo da história:
Mad Father é um RPG, estilo RPG Maker (RPGM), onde a história desenrola-se numa mansão onde a nossa protagonista, Aya Drevis, dorme. À meia-noite em ponto (um pouco cliché, mas quem pode reclamar? haha), acordada por um barulho súbito, fica curiosa e vai verificar a causa do mesmo... até que descobre algo muito mais insano do que alguma vez imaginara...! Será que a nossa pobre protagonista consegue sobreviver a esta aventura?

Jogabilidade:
Nós, o player, controlamos Aya com as teclas "WASD" ou com as teclas direcionais do teclado. Além das teclas de direção, a tecla "X" ou o "Esc" abrem o menu, onde podemos aceder ao inventário, que vai ser muito útil no decorrer do jogo.

[SPOILER]Não assim tanto, mas mais tarde no jogo, Aya vai conseguir adquirir uma mini motosserra, o que vai fazer com que ela seja capaz de destruir barris e cortar coisas frágeis, como animais mortos ou incapazes de se mover e de pequeno/médio porte, como cães (por exemplo). Ela pode ser acedida ao pressionarmos a tecla "C" ou o "SHIFT". [/SPOILER]

Não encontrei dificuldades nos controlo da personagens ou do acesso ao menu. Também gostei da velocidade padrão da personagem, o que faz com que não seja preciso correr mais que o necessário. (Se não der para escapar do inimigo, o problema não estará na velocidade, mas sim na estratégia!)

Tradução:
A tradução em Inglês está ótima, é possível entender o que se pretende transmitir ao jogador, especialmente porque a linguagem usada é simples e direta.

Sobre o Jogo:
A Galeria de Imagens (designada por "Museum") só pode ser desbloqueada depois de o jogo ter sido terminado, contendo todas as informações sobre cada personagem e os respetivos sprites, as imagens (com direito a sketchs originais e ideias anteriores em relação ao design dos personagens) apresentadas no jogo e o soundtrack do mesmo.
Nesta versão da Steam, podemos conseguir muitas "conquistas" (achievements), portanto explora tudo se gostas de obter todas as proezas! ;) Para finalizar este tópico, este jogo contém "Quick Time Events" (mini-jogos contra relógio que aparecem subitamente no decorrer do jogo, onde os nossos reflexos são testados haha) obrigatórios (algo que não existia na versão anterior, adicionado neste remake!), que consistem em pressionar um específica sequência de teclas de direção várias vezes, antes da barra de vida da Aya acabar!

Sobre of Finais:
O jogo tem 3 finais: dois Bad Endings (Finais Maus) e o Good Ending (Final Bom/ Final Verdadeiro). [SPOILER]Para fazeres o primeiro bad ending, é apenas preciso escolheres entregar o pai para a nossa mãe, numa das decisões finais; para fazeres o outro bad ending não podes ler o diário da Maria, pois isso dá acesso direto para o good ending. Para fazeres o good ending tens de ver o passado da Maria (lendo o seu diário) e ver se ela está bem logo depois, no sítio onde ela foi deixada, ferida. Se apanhares todas as gems/pérolas que se encontram no jogo consegues uma cena bónus, após o good ending.[/SPOILER] Todos os finais são fantásticos, então recomendo jogá-los todos~! Aliás, a cena bónus "If" que está no menu inicial do jogo só pode ser desbloqueada se fizermos todos os finais, então... é, boa sorte! hahaha

Arte do Jogo:
A arte do jogo é bem bonitinha mas não é muito diferente da versão anterior, o que me deixou desapontada. No entanto, encontramos cenas que não existiam antes e uma arte mais «soft», e isso é algo bem reconfortante de saber.

Valeu a pena?
Bem, eu já tinha jogado a versão anterior então sabia como era, no geral. No entanto, foi uma experiência nostálgica e um tempo muito bem passado! o/ Posso afirmar que o preço não é absurdo, é o valor ideal para este jogo! Boa jogatina, se comprares~!

30936138.review:
This game is amazing. I'm a huge fan of RPG and puzzle games and this game has both of what I like. The game has the underlying theme of spooky and horror, but it being scary can differ greatly for various people. There were a few jump scares in the game, but it wasn't too bad. The game even forewarns you ... so you have been warned if you scare easily. 

To the game! You play as Aya and you will start with some instructions on how to play the game. The story plot of the game isn't rich like final fantasy games, but it is quite rich and fantastic for how long the game is. I played the first time around and got true ending after 2 hours, then spent another hour collecting all of the achievements. I could not resist finding out what happened in Aya's past or what will happen to Aya as the game progresses. For two hours straight, I just kept playing and did not stop at all. The puzzle factors are interspersed into the game and I think it has a pretty good balance, Some are hard and some are easy. What was really nice is how forgiving the game can be. You are rarely pressured into making reflex responses and even if you fail them, the game has save points right before all of those events. So, even if you fail, you can just load your save slot and try until you get past it. Even more so if you are attempting achievement completion, the save spots are very convenient for you to do it quickly. Another nice factor in this game is the exclaimation points when you reach a point where you can interact with something/someone. Instead of forcing you to just click on everything, you can focus less on that and more on the game (highly appreciate that). To which brings to point, the details in this game. I highly praise the developer(s) on this, because it appears to me much thought and details went into the game (despite it being a short JRPG). There is a decent amount of exploration in the game and details you have to pay attention to if you want to be a completionist. 

Despite the positive factors I have mentioned earlier, some things did pop up to me as minor negatives. 1) The exclaimation mark popping up despite the event has already passed and 2) at the true ending scene, I'm left with a confused moment, because I'm not sure how should I take that ending. Is it actually a bad ending despite it being a "good" ending. If there is going to be a sequel to this game, I hope that question gets answered and the sequel will be as good or better than this current game.  

Overall, this is a good game that I would recommend for anybody that loves a good RPG with puzzle factors without long grinding monsters. 8.5/10!

首先要说的是，不建议使用汉化版。所谓的汉化方法其实只是暴力替换，说白了也就是买正版玩盗版。而汉化版其实还是用的v2，steam版已经是v3了，除了画风的改变，室内布置也进行了大幅改动，部分地方谜题也进行了变更。总的来说相比v2更人性化，更加合理，比如移动到关键物品周围头上会出现感叹号等。虽然现在百度查到的攻略也基本是v2的，但绝大部分也都能参照着来，唯一需要注意的只有靠近拼图附近游走的一株尖叫植物，肚皮泛白看起来像萝卜，用电锯把它锯了，一颗隐藏宝石就在这里。

另外，v3并不需要2周目就能找到关于母亲情书和父亲日记的隐藏线索。且v3相比v2增加了个if,主要以金发的视角讲述了aya离开前的一些事，算是增加金发的人物塑造吧。

如果实在是英文苦手，也建议玩完汉化版之后再通一遍steam版。由于成就不是很多，只要在end开始前存好档，完全可以一周目全成就。

[/spoiler]
Ночью Ая слышит чьи-то крики, доносящееся из лаборатории ее отца. Она решает пойти посмотреть что случилось. Однако когда выходит из комнаты, появляются два зомби, которые хотят ее убить. Она от них убегает, но на пути снова появляется зомби, который пытался ей что-то сказать, но она его не выслушав, убегает от него. На протяжении всей игры Ая должна найти своего отца и сбежать из этого дома.
 [spoiler] Ая, отправлявшись на поиски отца, узнавала от трупов, что они здесь не просто так - они эксперименты ее отца. Из людей доктор делал кукол. Они все ожили, чтобы отомстить ему. [/spoiler]

[spoiler] Отец очень любил свою дочь, он считал ее самой красивой девочкой, и хотел ее уберечь, но обезумев, он решает, что если из неё сделать куклу, она будет отличным экземпляром куклы и всегда будет с ним [/spoiler]

30897367.review:
[h1]All about the old times is nice.[/h1]

[b]Mad Father, is one of the best RPG of the days where games like Ib and The Witch's House were the real thing.[/b]

Mad Father, has been remade for the Steam version with different type of changes, like textures, music, gameplay and a bit of story.
The story from the start was a big vague, the free version didn't actually explain many things, but this had something more than the free one, i didn't recall it was so interesting and catching.
Oddly enough, i didn't play all through it yet, but i have my reasons, i think in the past i finished games like this 4 or more times.

Games like Mad Father were the kind of wonderful thing you had when there was nothing you could've played.
And i think, for what the creator has done and what kind of stress he put it into the game, even though it was free, he deserved money and affection for what he did.

I completely agree that everyone should buy this game, even for a price of 5$, because the game deserves more than anyone expects.

Even though, there's a bunch of things that didnt change, i think that if you're real fan of those times or someone that wants to spend 2 to 3 hours playing a game and chilling out, this is completely for you.

I'd say that you should buy it for the horror factor, but there isnt that much horror in here, unless you're really scared of some kinky stuff, there's jumpscares here in there, even though the game is quite nice at getting you when you're off guard.

[i](And for all the people that lived through the RPG era, just fucking steal this thing, i suggest you to do it, coming from someone that played these games for hours and hours.)[/i]

Well, i'll let you decide, but if you truly want to play a strange experience with a weird and wonderful story, buy the game right now and get a drink, turn off the lights put your headphones on to have one of the great experiences of your life.

[h1]I'd give this game a 8.5/10[/h1]

Thanks a lot for reading, and i hope i changed your mind.

I loved this game! It's a great horror rpg game <3. The horror aspect comes from the storyline, the enemies that chase you in some areas, and the grosteque environment around you. 
 
It is a simple plateform game where you move the character with the arrow keys and use the action key to interact with the environment around you. The enemies you face you must run away, or outsmart, and you will die if they attack you. You will die a lot in this game if not careful. 

The puzzles range from simple to one or two that I needed help with, but it's nothing impossible to solve. Some puzzles require quick reflexes of the fingers to get past, while others are simple of combining objects to get past.

I won't give away any spoilers, but the storyline is very interesting, maybe a little bit predictable in some ways, and there are multiple endings that you can achieve. A reminder that this is a horror story so be aware the endings will be shockers. I personally enjoyed the storyline and I was shocked to find out the true motive behind why this is all happening.

I recommend this game to anyone who loves horror plateformers. I was always creeped out by dolls, now I can't stop thinking about this game when I see them lol.

Karakterlerin isimlerini öğrendiğimize göre, hikaye'den devam edelim;
Akşam vakti Aya ve Doktor olan babası, Aya'nın odasında konuşurlar ve yarın Monika'nın ölüm yıl dönümü olduğunu hatırlatırlar birbirlerine, yarın ise kabrine ziyarete gideceklerine dair de söz verir babası aya'ya ve hadi kuzum uyu bakalım sen diyerekten yatağına yatırır ve çocuk odasını terk eder. Aya mışıl mışıl uyurken birden ev'de bir çığlık sesi duyar ve uyanır. İşte burada korku ve gerilim dolu anlar başlar, birçok odası olan dublex villa ve 1 koca bodrum katı olan bir ev de yaşamaktadır Aya ve Babası(Alfred). Aya her yeri arar lakin babasını bulamaz, başına kötü bir şey gelmiştir. 

Ortalıkta hayaletler ve zombi benzeri tiplemeler dolanmaktadır... Çok derin bir hikayesi olan bu oyun da uyuşturucu bağımlısı gibi ekranın karşısına kilitlenmişken Aya'nın bilmediği ailevi sırları da ortaya çıkarıyoruz. Hikaye'ye bir kez başladığınız da ondan bundan dinlemeye, bir daha bırakamıyorsunuz, çünkü "hmmm sanırım bir dahaki hikaye'de kesin bu katil çıkacak yeaaa" diye düşünürken aniden oyun sizi ters köşe yaptırıyor, gelirken de 1 winston al diye sipariş veriyor.

Oyunun en sevdiğim yanı ise 4 farklı sonu bulunması, 3 tanesi bizim yaptığımız final seçimleri doğrultusunda belirleniyor, 4.final ise oyun içerisinde toplanılan "GEM"leri tamamlarsanız görebiliyorsunuz.

[b] SES: [/b]
Kimi zaman anime tarzında konuşma sesleri, kimi zaman sert ve tok efektler, kimi zaman da sanki Mozart'ın "Requiem Lacrimosa" eserini dinliyormuşsunuz gibi tüylerinizi diken diken eden karanlık şatolarda ölüm marşı gibi çalınan piano veya organ temelli upuzun parçalar siz oynarken eşlik ediyor.

[b] GÖRÜNTÜ: [/b]
Görüntü hakkında diyecek bir şey yok, pixel :D
Zaten 3D olup olmaması bir şey ifade etmiyor bu denli kaliteli bir hikayesi varken.
Oyun ufak pencere olarak açılıyor, Full ekrana geçmek için "F10" tuşunu kullanınız. (ben ilk başladığımda sorun yaşadıydım bu tuşu keşfedene kadar)

Gamepad desteği var ve keyifli, arkanıza yaslanın tadını çıkarın.

29935436.review:
I'm writing this review after having completed the game 3 times and gotten all achievements for it. This games story is very good. The game is simple, its a horror game in which you move around and solve puzzles with hints and clues and try to figure out how to get to the next area. The soundtrack is very good, I loved it. The game itself is simple and fun. It was not rage inducing difficult but wasn't overly boring easy either. This game shines with it's story. It's simple at first and doesn't give away too much too fast. It has a good pace. And leaves yu asking the questions till specific moments when you figure out whats really going on. Though for those of us used to the Horror Genre we may be able to figure that out ourselves as it doesn't take rocket science.

I encountered different things in each play through, So I am unsure what exactly the differences are and how to achieve them. But I noticed things each time that I did not come acrossed the prior time. This added to its replay value for me as I re-played it through just to see if I could find a hint at what role a certain person who's name I won't mention actually plays. The game will leave you asking questions regarding the story, but will also answer them. Which will also make you ask more questions. It's an interesting story to put it simply. I got the game for 4.99$ and I would recommend this game to anyone who likes horror games and the paranormal / gore intensive stories and games. It was a hidden gem in the 2d horror that I found and I very much loved the game, enough to replay it 3x. 

10/10 Loved the game.

29822263.review:
I am not one for RPG maker games. But this is a shining example that 3D graphics and fancy gameplay mechanics are needed to tell an amazing story. Mad father is a Horror Adventure game. In the vein of IB and Misao. But i found those games a bit slow for my tastes. Mad father wastes no time creeping you out. Everything from twisted abominations to tortured souls make up the scares in this gem of a game. I bought it thinking "Hey, it's 5 bucks, I know it's been free for the longest time online; Let me support the Developer. I wound up playing for almost 3 hours upon my inital purchase. This game is great. Music is top notch, with gothic droning tunes and ambient chamber music. The standing points of this game are 2 things. The Narrative and atmosphere. Let me be frank here, this isn't a game you're going to play for the gameplay, this is a game that you're going to enjoy for the story and ambiance.  Gameplay consists of typical adventure game item puzzles and a few oddly placed stealth sections. 

TL;DR Amazing story and atmosphere, not much gameplay.

[h1][b]　　Mad Father——爱与诗[spoiler]（尸）[/spoiler]的[spoiler]黑[/spoiler]童话[/b][/h1]

　　[h1]　　第一印象[/h1]
　　高跟鞋踩在地毯上沉闷的踢踏声，路过残肢时丝[spoiler]（尸）[/spoiler]滑的嘎吱声，每每拾起陈年旧物，思念的走马灯伴随着往事徐徐旋转。
　　[h1]　　宏观评价[/h1]
　　1.游戏不支持音频，但是女主人公受惊吓时的娇叹与狂父的疯吼为寂静的游戏添色不少。
　　2.游戏进程富有逻辑性，不过在卡关的时候，没有适时的提示，独立通关存在一定难度。游戏的收集元素十分抢眼[spoiler]（二楼西侧走廊爬行丧尸对暗道的暗示、帮助地下室一层非主线NPC的丧尸找回身体）[/spoiler]，不过由于缺乏必要提示、可活动范围大的缘故，欲独立集齐宝石难度巨大。
　　3.游戏存在二周目元数，对于没有耐心的快餐玩家而言让人倍感乏力。有别于仅通过突发事件吓唬玩家、烘托气氛感染玩家，《狂父》更倾向于向玩家自然而然地倾诉蛛丝马迹，引导玩家自主体验抽吸剥茧后的细思极恐。[spoiler]比起母恋父父恋尸、阿雅转世人偶的情节，我最喜欢女承父业的结局，喜欢兼于天然呆与天然黑间的反差萌，喜欢这则洁白宣纸上用墨泼出来的黑童话。[/spoiler]

　　[h1]　　关于汉化[/h1]
　　游戏不支持中文，第三方汉化是以下载汉化游戏后覆盖文件的形式使用的，游戏中的英语难度适中，建议不要加载汉化补丁。第三方汉化不支持解锁成就，而且汉化补丁本身源自于稍旧版本的《狂父》，加载汉化补丁将无法体验瓜子脸的人物立绘与敞亮的游戏场景。

　　[u]少年置于额头的谢吻褪去的是少女的清纯，熊熊大火燃烬的公馆挣脱的是父母的枷锁。“山间诊所地荒人稀，而小生宅中私立医院苦于无医执刀，敢问阿雅教授愿否下榻问诊~” [/u]

29285257.review:
Oh mein Gott, Was für ein Horror-Trip!

Zugegeben, ich kannte das Spiel schon... zum Teil. Ich habe irgendwann mal die Original-Version gespielt und da bereits 2 Endings geschafft, aber leider die Gallerie nie freigeschaltet bekommen... Mir fehlte am Ende immer ein Edelstein...

Mad Father wurde für das Steam-Release nochmal so richtig aufgebrezelt. Die Grafik wurde deutlich aufgebessert und sogar das Layout der Villa wurde stellenweise massiv verändert.
Man könnte meinen das Spiel wurde nochmal von Grund auf neu erstellt. Nur die Story... die blieb gleich.

Positiv
+ Grusel-Atmosphäre
+ Richtig gute Story
+ Dezente, aber nicht übertriebene Jumpscares
+ Neue, oftmals gruselige Gimmicks
+ Zusätzliche Puppen an diversen Stellen, wo vorher keine waren.
+ Das Freikämpfen wurde überarbeitet. Statt Tasten-spam jetzt Tasten-kombi! 

Negativ
- Diverse Grusel-Gimmicks, die etwas zu unauffällig sind und schnell übersehen werden

Gerade in Bezug auf gruselige Gimmicks wurde hier nochmal tief in die Trickkiste gegriffen und viele kleine aber feiner Extras fanden ihren Weg ins Spiel.
Diese sind allerdings nicht immer auffällig und oftmals hat man nur das Gefühl "Da war doch was... oder?" .... Aber vielleicht war das ja Absicht, um den Spieler zu verunsichern...

Insgesamt bekommt man bei Mad Father guten Horror in bester 16bit Grafik präsentiert!
Und die Story... meine Fresse, würd gerne wissen wer sich den Sche*ss ausgedacht hat... Das Spiel macht ja sogar Amnesia Konkurenz!

10/10

29252363.review:
A primeira vez que joguei Mad Father foi aos 13 anos, depois de um amigo instalar no meu PC e querer jogar comigo. Até então, nunca tinha sido "a fã" de terror, salvo apenas por adorar os primeiros Silent Hill e Resident Evil, tendo jogado-os no PlayStation 1 quando mais nova. Porém eu morria de medo e evitava ao máximo jogar qualquer coisa no estilo - por isso, fui terminante contra, mas ele insistiu tanto que eu acabei aceitando. E foi a minha porta de entrada para o mundo do indie RPGMaker.
A partir daí, comecei a procurar por mais e mais jogos, como Ib, Misao, Mermaid Swamp, Off, Yume Nikki, enfim, qualquer um no estilo de Mad Father. E, apesar de amar muito alguns desses games, outros nem tanto, eu sempre voltava para o primeiro.
Agora com 17 anos, eis que me deparo com uma surpresa: Mad Father, updated, na Steam, por um preço bom. Não pensei duas vezes antes de comprar e jogar tudo de novo.
Então, agora que já estamos ambientados, vamos ao ponto:
A história não sofreu grandes alterações, a parte de alguns detalhes aqui e ali, nada de realmente importante; o plot continua o mesmo da versão gratuita, apesar de algumas poucas mudanças nos finais, nada que saia do original. Os gráficos parecem estar mais definidos, com novas criaturas bem desenhadas, e novos sprites para alguns personagens.
Todavia, o prêmio de recomendação vai para os jumpscares e extras da versão paga.
O jogo está muito melhor no quesito susto. O que já achava assustador, agora está mais ainda, com novos momentos tensos e suspresas. Por exemplo, em dado momento você está tranquilamente caminhando, quando passa por uma porta e adivinha? Aparece uma boneca na sua frente. Em outro, você escuta uma risadinha. Em outro ainda, algo vem correndo na sua direção e você sente seu coração parar por um instante.
Uma coisa importante é a história dos personagens secundários, melhor contada agora. Pessoas que você achava que apareciam no jogo por aparecer e que não tinham utilidade alguma (a não ser em um ou dois momentos da história) passam a ter histórias e passados ligados a Alfred, Monika e Aya.  
Destaque para o final If, que me deixou bem surpresa, mas nada de spoiler! As conquistas na steam também são instigantes e bem feitas, para realmente deixar o jogador com vontade de explorar mais ainda.
Enfim, eu adoro esse jogo e recomendo para todos que querem gastar pouco em um terror simples e curto, porém excelente e bem-feito para novatos e mais conhecedores desse estilo.

29097130.review:
Mad Father is a small horror game set in the focus of a little girl named Aya, who had a fairly happy life with her loving family. However, this definitely isn't your normal family. Aya's father carries the title of a scientist, who works primarily on humans he picks off the street. He nurishes them, gains their trust, and soon tortures them to madness, killing them in the end. Later on, Aya's mother dies of sickness, and Aya is left with just her father and her assisstant. But the dread isn't over yet, for Aya's mother returns, and with a curse to boot. The curse turns Aya's mansion into a horror house filled with all the tortured souls of Father's experiements, back for revenge. Aya's mission is to save her father from her angered mother, no matter the danger.
I truly enjoyed this game. The game basically tells you the beginning, then throws you in, saying, "Go ahead, explore". And the more you explore, the more you find out just what horrors your father's experiments contained. The puzzles are not hard, but do require some brain power to figure out. Plus, the game rewards you for exploring and wanting to know more on just what the hell happened to everything.
The game mainly focuses on exploration and puzzles. Whether it's finding the right tool in the nearby toilet, or trying to capture a cleaver-weilding madman while not getting your body diced, this game does a good job in being tense and puzzling.
The sprite art is well done, along with the music and sound design. Nothing spectacular, but it gets the job done.
All in all, I liked this game. If you like a good 4 hour horror game with a neat story, spooky interactions with experiments gone wrong, and good ol' fashioned puzzles, you may like this game too.

28792100.review:
I first heard about Mad Father a few years ago when it first (I believe) was released and started getting attention by famous Youtubers such as PewDiePie and so on. I never watched any of those "Let's plays" because I'm not necessarily interested in those kinds of videos. The reason why I kept receiving suggestions of videos of Mad Father is most likely due to the fact that I did make an exception and watched a "Let's play" of a similar game called "The Crooked Man", though I never paid any attention to Mad Father the name of the game stuck with me, probably because it's quite easy to remember.

Anyways, a few months ago I saw that the game was released on Steam and generous as I am when it comes to spending money on games I don't need and may never play for that matter, I decided to buy it since it was only $5 with an extra 10% off as a special launch price. I did intend on playing it when I first bought it, but the problem with owning as many games as I do is that I always scroll though my library looking for something to play but due to having so many options I usually just end up playing Rocket League or Team Fortress 2, so Mad Father quickly turned into just "another" game in my library. 

Yesterday however I got around to installing and playing the game and I got to say that I am genuinely suprised of how much I actually enjoyed it.

I got hooked on the game after only playing it for a couple of minutes thanks to the story of the game. In fact, I would like to take a moment to appreciate how original and unique the story felt and played out, it was twisted and disturbing least to say. It's quite rare that I get hooked on a games story, but this one really punched me in the face. The story develops amazingly during the 4-6 hours it takes to complete the game (If I were smarter and didn't have to look up Youtube videos explaining what to do all the time I'm sure I could have completed it way quicker). It's filled with twists and decisions which eventually leads to the 3 possible endings. Now while I would like to put on my tinfoil hat and bring up 50 different theories spinning around in my head after completing it, I think it's in everyone's interest that I keep this review spoiler free. 

The game is, however, of course not for everyone. The gameplay can possibly  be considered dull by a lot of people if you're not into these types of games. But I strongly recommend you taking a couple of hours of your day to play this game from start to finish even if the gameplay may not suite you, because the story really was an experience not to turn your back on. 

Besides the fantastic story the game was very well designed, the artstyle and the level design really built an atmosphere that went hand-in-hand with the gameplay and really did a good job on capturing the sinister plot of the game. In fact, everything just simply worked together, the music, the illustrations, the sound effects, visual effects, the very limited voice acting and the writing itself.

Now a lot of people are wondering if it's worth picking this one up for $5 considering the original version is completely free. As someone who's never played the original one I can't really compare the versions back to back, however, as I mentioned I did watch a few videos on Youtube to figure out how to progress in the game and I can say that this version simply does look way better in every aspect, but I guess that goes from one individual to another depending on what art-style you personally enjoy. But if anything by buying it you will support great indie developers who I think really outdid themselves on this one, and I really hope to see more games like this pop up on Steam in the future. There are most likely a few more differences between the versions, but I haven't really looked into it myself.

To sum things up, really well written and original story (especially for a originally free indie game) that is acompanied by great visuals and sound design. For $5 you really do get what you pay for, even more considering there are 3 endings with room for a sequel. If you're a horror fan like me (or not) I suggest you pick this one up and experience it yourself.

28785287.review:
The description on its Steam page is actually you need to know before you start playing the game. The whole gameplay is just as interesting as my first impression of it when I first saw the title and the capsule art. It's so fun and immersive that I didn't even notice I've been playing this for over seven hours already.

Mad Father is about a crazy family. You play the role of Aya Drevis, a ten year old daughter of a mad scientist. Despite being aware of her father's inhumane hobby, Aya still loves and respects him. The story begins at midnight of her mother's death anniversary who, according to her father, died of an illness. While attempting to sleep, she heard her father scream for help, and she is determined to come to his rescue. However, the further she goes, the more she learns about her father's nature.

There's not much to say about the story. It is fairly straightforward and even predictable. That's not to say that the story wasn't good. In fact, knowing how it unfolds adds to the excitement because the gameplay is almost the story in and of itself. Every character is very likeable except the father, although the father still has a reasonable motive behind his actions. There's no other word to describe him other than 'Mad', which stays true to the title of the game. While the gameplay is a masterpiece, the selling point of this game is the art. I must say that it was what made me want to get this game in the first place, and it didn't let me down. The game was an eyecandy until the end despite the dark and gore theme. The music was also very ambient. I honestly did not notice the background music, and that's a good thing. That means it was a part of story.

Overall, This is one of the games where the story, gameplay, art, and music all work together seamlessly. I enjoyed it immensely and would recommend it to everyone regardless of your taste in games. Besides, who doesn't want to be a little girl whose weapon of choice is a chainsaw?

28768199.review:
I remember playing the older version of this game a while ago, but I forgot everything that the game held. Mad Father is one of the most beloved of the RPG horror "series" next to The Witchs House, Ib and Corpse Party. Im really glad that Sen brought the remastered edition to Steam. 

Pros:
-Story is beautifully written. What I like in a game is difficulty, story and well-developed characters. Mad Father has all of this. The story is both messed up and beautiful at the same time, and the ending is mind blowing, though I believe its up to  interpretation for the player. 
-Characters are the best. Aya is the perfect protagonist in a game such as this, Alfred is a pure psychopath, and I will never again trust any chick named Monika. This is the second horror game I have played that the crazy chick is called Monika. Never again. I loved Ogre, too, whom also appears in Misao. I wonder if this game ties into Misao in some way.
-Graphics are amazing for an RPG horror. With the new edition, the character portraits have changed a lot, look a whole lot nicer, and I believe the sprites have too. Setting design has also been updated and looks wonderful! 
-Puzzles are interesting and not impossibly difficult, which was a cavil of mine with The Witchs House. 
-Actually scary, anxiety-inducing with exemplary sound design and background music. Atmosphere is perfect. 

Mad Father is one of the best horror RPGs out there. This newer version is just as good as the old, though the graphics are much better. This is everything but a plain, anime visual novel RPG, something that bothers me when I try to introduce friends to these types of games. Mad Father is a wonderful experience. Would recommend!
